item.dc:creator: Sal Paolantonio
item.title: Source: New York Giants Antonio Pierce 'optimistic' he will not be indicted
item.description: Giants' Antonio Pierce is "cautiously optimistic" that a Manhattan grand jury will vote on Monday to clear him of felony gun possession charges, according to a source close to Pierce, who the team says will not talk about the case until it is resolved.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Report: Boston Red Sox fired 2 staffers in steroid probe
item.description: A Boston newspaper is reporting the Red Sox fired two security staffers last summer after an investigation into steroid use.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Buick Open: Tiger Woods earns 69th career Tour win
item.description: Tiger Woods shot a 69 Sunday and coasted to a three-shot victory with a 20-under 268 at the Buick Open for the 69th PGA Tour title of his career.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Minnesota Vikings rookie receiver Percy Harvin agrees to 5-year deal
item.description: The Minnesota Vikings have agreed to terms with first-round draft pick Percy Harvin on a five-year deal.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: World championships: Michael Phelps' 400 medley relay team ends worlds with record
item.description: Michael Phelps and the U.S. 400-meter medley relay team closed the fastest meet in swimming history with an appropriate finish Sunday night -- the 43rd world record.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Cabrera gets cycle, Yanks get win over ChiSox
item.description: Melky Cabrera became the 15th Yankees player and their first in 14 years to hit for the cycle, leading New York to an 8-5 victory over the Chicago White Sox on Sunday afternoon.

item.dc:creator: Mike Sando
item.title: Arizona Cardinals RB Beanie Wells sidelined with sprained ankle
item.description: Beanie Wells has a sprained ankle that could sideline him for the short term, Arizona Cardinals coach Ken Whisenhunt told the team's Web site Sunday.

item.dc:creator: Terry Blount
item.title: Rain postpones Sprint Cup at Pocono to Monday
item.description: Wet conditions Sunday caused NASCAR to postpone the Sunoco Red Cross Pennsylvania 500 until 12:15 p.m. Monday at Pocono Raceway.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Eric Mangini says Cleveland Browns won't rotate starting QBs
item.description: Browns coach Eric Mangini says he will not rotate quarterbacks, that he has no timetable on picking a starter and that he envisions both Derek Anderson and Brady Quinn on Cleveland's roster once the regular season begins.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Solheim Cup: Michelle Wie selected as wild card to make debut
item.description: Michelle Wie has been selected as a wild card to make her Solheim Cup debut for the United States, and Catriona Matthew has made Europe's team after capturing the Women's British Open.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Melvin Mora, of Baltimore Orioles, rips manager Dave Trembley after another benching
item.description: Disgruntled third baseman Melvin Mora lashed out at Baltimore Orioles manager Dave Trembley on Sunday after being benched for the third time in four games.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Catriona Matthew wins Women's British Open
item.description: Catriona Matthew won the Women's British Open by three strokes on Saturday.

item.dc:creator: John Clayton
item.title: New England Patriots work out, expected to sign QB Cleo Lemon
item.description: The Patriots, in the market for a backup quarterback, have worked out NFL veteran Cleo Lemon and are expected to sign him Saturday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Arturo Gatti's second autopsy doesn't rule out homicide
item.description: A second autopsy performed at the request of former boxer Arturo Gatti's family has not ruled out homicide in his death.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Tarvaris Jackson of Minnesota Vikings leaves field with reported MCL injury
item.description: Minnesota Vikings quarterback Tarvaris Jackson left the field on Saturday morning with an apparent leg injury.
